meanings.definition: To disguise or hide by blending in with surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The chameleon was camouflaging itself against the green leaves.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was camouflaging his position in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky spy was caught camouflaging behind a potted plant.
meanings.sent4: Her shy personality was camouflaging her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The clever octopus was camouflaging among the rocks to avoid predators.

meanings.definition: The act of concealing or disguising something by using camouflage.
meanings.sent1: The camouflaging of the tank made it almost invisible in the desert.
meanings.sent2: The camouflaging of the bird's nest helped protect the eggs from predators.
meanings.sent3: The magician's camouflaging of the rabbit in the hat amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The camouflaging of the treasure chest fooled the pirates searching for it.
meanings.sent5: The camouflaging of the spy's gear allowed them to blend in seamlessly with the surroundings.
